result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy L. McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randy L. McBride is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randy L. McBride was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not have contact with Dick's Sporting Goods Store in Kenosha, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for sentencing 6/14/22 paid by county $ 34.50 for 20cf880 & 22cf525

ADDRESS INFO for Randy L. McBride
Current: PO Box 900, Racine Correctional Institution, Sturtevant, WI 53177 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: PO Box 661, DCI, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

09:12 AM Defendant Randy L. McBride appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Defendant in custody at DCI.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  DAR Reporter:  Amanda Chentnik.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Retail Theft, Repeater; found guilty by the court.
Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion.
Parties waived the PSI report and proceeded to sentencing w/20CF880 case.
Ct 1:
SENTENCE IMPOSED AND STAYED:
Initial Term of Confinement:  18 months, forthwith.
Extended Supervision:  18 months.
Total Length of Sentence: 36 months. 
No sentence credit given.

Defendant placed on 18 months probation;
Conditions of prob/extended supervision given.
All to run consecutive to 20CF880 and Racine cases 20CF749 & 20CF1609.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP programs.
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. 
Appeal rights given.
Plea Hearing set for 6/14/2022 at 9:00 am with 20CF880 case at the request of the defense attorney.  Need writ to DCI.

ADDRESS INFO for Randy L. McBride
Current: PO Box 661, DCI, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2022)
Prior: 5216 6th Street, Racine, WI 53405

Defendant Randy L. McBride appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: John F or Dick's Sporting Goods in Kenosha, WI.

03:02 PM   Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk: P. Trossen.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Preliminary Hearing set on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
